docs.lead_paragraph: In trendy, hipster London or New York, it's all about juicing, vegan diets and snacking on kale crisps. Thousands of miles away, in Nairobi or Bogota, the middle classes are more likely to reach for roasted goat or a juicy steak.

headline.main: Kale or Steak? Change in Diet key to U.N. Plan to End Hunger by 2030
headline.print_headline: Kale or Steak? Change in Diet key to U.N. Plan to End Hunger by 2030

docs.snippet: In trendy, hipster London or New York, it's all about juicing, vegan diets and snacking on kale crisps. Thousands of miles away, in Nairobi or Bogota, the middle classes are more likely to reach for roasted goat or a juicy steak.

headline.main: Fat Dad: A Vegetarian Rosh Hashana

docs.abstract: After my dad returned from a six-month stay at a fat farm, I cooked my father his first vegetarian Rosh Hashana dinner.
docs.snippet: After my dad returned from a six-month stay at a fat farm, I cooked my father his first vegetarian Rosh Hashana dinner.

docs.lead_paragraph: The measure, which is set to take effect in December, requires many chain restaurants to post a warning label next to items that contain over 2,300 milligrams of sodium.

headline.main: New York City Health Board Backs Warning on Menu Items With High Salt
headline.print_headline: Health Board Backs Warning on Menu Items With High Salt

docs.abstract: New York City Board of Health adopts measure requiring chain restaurants to alert diners to extremely high-sodium dishes with saltshaker symbol on menus; health officials say threshold for warning label is lenient at 2,300 milligrams and hope that move will serve as example for other communities.
docs.snippet: The measure, which is set to take effect in December, requires many chain restaurants to post a warning label next to items that contain over 2,300 milligrams of sodium.

byline.original: By BENJAMIN MUELLER and MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM

docs.lead_paragraph: Jamaican sprinters Asafa Powell and Sherone Simpson have settled a legal case with a nutrition company that sold the supplement Epiphany D1 which contained the banned substance oxilofrine, their management company said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Powell, Simpson Settle Case With Nutrition Company
headline.print_headline: Powell, Simpson Settle Case With Nutrition Company

docs.snippet: Jamaican sprinters Asafa Powell and Sherone Simpson have settled a legal case with a nutrition company that sold the supplement Epiphany D1 which contained the banned substance oxilofrine, their management company said on Tuesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The rate of child deaths around the world has dropped by more than half since 1990 — but not enough to reach the United Nations goal of a two-thirds reduction by 2015, according to a new report released Tuesday evening.

headline.main: UN: Rate of Child Deaths Drops by Half _ but Misses UN Goal
headline.print_headline: UN: Rate of Child Deaths Drops by Half _ but Misses UN Goal

docs.snippet: The rate of child deaths around the world has dropped by more than half since 1990 — but not enough to reach the United Nations goal of a two-thirds reduction by 2015, according to a new report released Tuesday evening.

docs.lead_paragraph: Bankrate Inc agreed to pay $15 million to settle U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission charges that it engaged in accounting fraud to ensure that its financial results met analyst expectations.

headline.main: Bankrate to Pay $15 Million to Settle SEC Fraud Charges
headline.print_headline: Bankrate to Pay $15 Million to Settle SEC Fraud Charges

docs.snippet: Bankrate Inc agreed to pay $15 million to settle U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission charges that it engaged in accounting fraud to ensure that its financial results met analyst expectations.

docs.lead_paragraph: If kids learn good food habits in school, the next generation of adults will be wiser eaters.
docs.snippet: If kids learn good food habits in school, the next generation of adults will be wiser eaters.

docs.lead_paragraph: An analysis of nearly 13,000 species of fish, invertebrates and other marine organisms is an ambitious effort to map the future ranges of ocean life.

headline.main: Warming Oceans Putting Marine Life ‘In a Blender’
headline.print_headline: Heat Up Water. Mix Species. Wait.

docs.abstract: Scientists are developing computer models to map how climate change may drive species migration in planet's warming oceans.
docs.snippet: An analysis of nearly 13,000 species of fish, invertebrates and other marine organisms is an ambitious effort to map the future ranges of ocean life.
